listitem.para:
Nothing?
More Nothing?
Nothing supreme?
Nothing maxima.

Change the "if CAN_NODES != 0" to be an ifndef statement in the start. That means the checkCAN and requestCellVoltages lines will not execute unless CAN_NODES is a non-zero number in Main.h before compiling.
Potentially, check if the data is actually being updated by HIL. There is no real instantiation of associating the CAN variables with the messages being read in in the canTask(), so maybe call on those methods to read in those values, in case it doesnt work.
Goal 3.
Final Goal.

Just add the LV current or the added up current to the current logging situation. Could be useful in future if we want to be tryhards and use a neural network to process currents or just to log our current and see what went wrong in the race. (Latter is way more likely)
Goal 2.
Goal 3.
Final Goal.

Use the void pointer stuff in the addRecord method. Fix it up. Not required, but preferred.
Goal 2.
Goal 3.
Final Goal.

Make better structs for all the datatypes passed through and integrate it properly (mainly just thermistor vs non-thermistor to be honest)
Make a better struct for time and integrate it in a way so that the update code isn't nasty.
Once the above stuff is implemented, please remove all extra methods, variables, etc. that are declared.
Final Goal.

PLEASE remove the whole screen parameter situation. Change the "screen" variable in the Main.h to be a #define macro and then just check the value from here by directly including Main.h and finding that value. Ez.
Remove all unused vars and tighten up methods.
There are WAY more macros (#define statements) that need to be written for defining some frequently used values in display. Can't think of them off the top of my head, but make and use those.
Change the thermistor code to use "NUM_THERMI" from Main.h

Based on refinements made for preCharge/controls.ino, remove spare and redundant variables. And just generally ALL the spare variables.
Based on the changes implemented for SoC, I would add another variable for the low-voltage current sneors or any other current sensors you add
CHANGE THE NUM_THERMI based on the number of thermistors that Powertain settles on.
Final Goal.

Refine further.
Look for redundant variables, pins, etc and remove.
Change the name of preCharge. It's not just preCharge now, I personally like the name "controls.ino" and "controls.h". Make sure you change the #includes as well if you do that. Please Please change "preCharge" or whatever it's called to not use this many global/struct variables. It doesn't need everything globalized, it can pass them as parameters and eventually output to global variables *preCharge.angle_X and *preCharge.angle_Y.
TEST

Change the preChargeStruct data to use less floats, etc.
NUMBER_OF_LTCS needs to be changed for the REAL number of LTCs. MOTORCONTROLLER_TEMP_MAX might need to be changed depending. MOTOR_TEMP_MAX might need to be changed depending.
Goal 3.
Final Goal.
